subject: Education
title: The Dunning-Kruger Effect in Learning
description: One-minute skill: The Dunning-Kruger Effect in Learning.

hook.text: The worst performers in a study rated themselves near the top.

buildup.text: Dunning and Kruger found that incompetence also impairs self-assessment.

discovery.text: Without enough knowledge to judge quality, you can't see your own gaps.

twist.text: High performers underestimate themselvesâ€”they assume others find it equally easy.

climax.text: Calibration improves when learners get feedback and see expert-level examples.

punchline.text: The first step to competence is realizing you're not there yet.

quiz.question: Why do low performers overestimate their abilities?
options: They lack the knowledge needed to judge their own gaps
They study harder than high performers
